text: April unemployment rates ranged from 2.8% in NE, NH, SD, and UT to 8.5% in HI.
Twenty-two states saw three-decade peaks in annual house price growth in Q1 2021.
Only IA, SD, UT, and WA saw an increase in GDP from Q4 2019 to Q4 2020.
After a year of volatility, leisure jobs are up in all states, from 29% in AK to 101% in RI.
Among states, average private weekly earnings in April ranged from $778 in MS to $1,245 in CA.
From Q1 2020 to Q1 2021, house price increases ranged from 4.7% in HI to 23.7% in ID.
State and local public education jobs declined over the year in 25 states.
Michigan’s unemployment rate was 4.9% in April 2021, down from 23.6% in April 2020.
NY’s accommodation and food services GDP fell 46% between Q4 2019 and Q4 2020.
Retail employment in April 2021 exceeded January 2020 levels in only nine states.
Manufacturing GDP increased in 44 states and DC between Q3 2020 and Q4 2020.
